intro: Turraea heterophylla, commonly known as the variable-leaf turraea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its variable leaf shapes, which range from ovate to elliptic. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are usually alternate and may have a rough or hairy texture. Turraea heterophylla produces small greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments.
